00003 MinMaxDesign::MinMaxDesign(int _nsamples)
00004 {
00005     if (nsamples <= 0) {
00006         cout << "Warning: Negative sample number in MinMaxDesign constructor." << endl;
00007         cout << "         Reverting to default (100)" << endl;
00008         nsamples = 100;
00009     }
00010     else
00011         nsamples = _nsamples;
00012 }

00023 ivec MinMaxDesign::subsample(mat X, int n)
00024 {
00025     if (n <= 0)
00026         cerr << "Invalid sample size in MinMaxDesign::subsample(...)" << endl;
00027     
00028     double minMaxDist = 0.0;
00029     ivec bestSubsample = randperm(X.rows());
00030     
00031     for (int i=0; i<nsamples; i++) {
00032         
00033         // Generate random subsample
00034         ivec irand = randperm(X.rows());
00035         ivec irandn = irand(0,n-1);
00036         mat S = X.get_rows(irandn);
00037         
00038         // Compute max distance in this subsample
00039         double maxDist =  distanceMax(S);
00040 
00041         // Keep subsample if has min max distance
00042         if (maxDist < minMaxDist) {
00043                 bestSubsample = irandn;
00044                 minMaxDist = maxDist;
00045         }
00046     }
00047     
00048     return bestSubsample;
00049 }
00050 
00054 double MinMaxDesign::distanceMax(mat X)
00055 {
00056    double distMax = 0.0;
00057    double d;
00058    
00059    for (int i=0; i<X.rows(); i++) {
00060        vec x1 = X.get_row(i);
00061        for (int j=i; j<X.rows(); j++) {
00062            d = norm(x1 - X.get_row(j));
00063            if (d>distMax) distMax = d;
00064        }
00065    }
00066    return distMax;
00067 }
